alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 27 at 1:01PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ongoing runoff from excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, the western reaches of the Susitna Valley. This includes the locations along the Skwentna and Yentna Rivers. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff has caused rapid rises along the Susitna River including the Skwentna and Yentna tributaries. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Up to 3 inches of precipitation has fallen across the Susitna Basin since Saturday afternoon. Rivers in the area are rising and there could be some delayed responses in the western part of the Susitna. Watersheds in this area could continue to see elevated river conditions through the beginning of the week. Additional rainfall over the next 2 days could keep river levels elevated and minor flooding a possibility. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along any creeks, streams, or rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action. - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
info.instruction: Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
